</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 369</row>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** up to 10 willing creatures
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

You bypass your targets' rational minds, instilling them with unshakable conviction and zeal. The targets each gain 12 temporary Hit Points and a +2 status bonus to Will saves against mental effects, as their faith overrides the signals from their own bodies and minds. If you tell a target to do something, it must comply with your request, though if it would normally find the task repugnant, it can attempt a Will save at the end of its turn each round due to the cognitive dissonance. On a success, it ends the spell's effects on itself entirely.

---
**Heightened (9th)** The temporary Hit Points increase to 18, and the status bonus to Will saves increases to +3.
_source.name: Zealous Conviction

</row>

**Area** 20-foot radius, 40-foot tall cylinder

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You negate gravity's effects in the area. Creatures float in place unless they can Push Off a surface. Pushing Off is a single action which has the [move](/Traits.aspx?ID=114) trait, allowing the creature to move half its Speed in a straight line through the area. After Pushing Off a surface, the creature continues to move the same distance at the start of each of its turns until it leaves the area or Pushes Off against something else. A creature pushing against an untethered object of its size or smaller causes both the creature and the object to move at the same speed, but in opposite directions. Creatures who can levitate or fly can use those abilities to move around in the area without having to push off anything. Creatures who can't levitate or fly are usually on the ground, giving them a surface from which to push off.

 You can Dismiss this spell. When _zero gravity_ ends, all creatures and objects in the area fall back down.
_source.name: Zero Gravity

**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 89 1.1 **Tradition** [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Duration** 1 minute --- Invoking the celestial realms, you transform into a Medium angel battle form. When you cast this spell, choose balisse, choral, monadic deva, or movanic deva. The battle form is Small if you choose choral. While in this form, you gain the angel and celestial traits. You have hands in this battle form and can use manipulate actions. You can Dismiss the spell. You gain the following statistics and abilities regardless of the form that you choose:
  • AC = 22 + your level. Ignore your armor check's penalty and Speed reduction.
  • 40 temporary Hit Points and weakness 10 to evil damage.
  • [Darkvision](/Rules.aspx?ID=415).
  • One or more attacks specific to the battle form you choose. You're trained with them. Your attack modifier is +25, and you use the listed damage. Melee attacks are Strength based (for the purpose of the [enfeebled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13) condition, for example), and ranged attacks are Dexterity based. If your attack modifier is higher for the given unarmed attack or weapon, you can use it instead.
  • [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) modifier of +25, unless your own modifier is higher.
You also gain specific abilities based on the type of angel you choose: - **[Balisse](/Monsters.aspx?ID=15)** Speed 30 feet, fly 40 feet; Perception modifier of +26 to detect lies and [illusions](/Traits.aspx?ID=92) unless your own modifier is higher; **Melee** scimitar ([forceful](/Traits.aspx?ID=180), [sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194)), **Damage** 2d6+12 slashing plus 1d6 fire and 1d6 good. - **[Choral](/Monsters.aspx?ID=14)** Speed 30 feet, fly 40 feet; +1 status bonus to AC and saves against [sonic](/Traits.aspx?ID=147) and [auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16); **Melee** fist ([agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 2d6+12 bludgeoning plus 1d6 good; **Ranged** piercing hymn ([range 90 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 1d6+12 sonic plus 1d6 good, and [deafened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=8) for 1 round on a critical hit. - **[Monadic Deva](/Monsters.aspx?ID=543)** Speed 30 feet, fly 40 feet; +2 status bonus on saves against [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects and effects that manipulate souls; **Melee** holy mace ([shove](/Traits.aspx?ID=193)), **Damage** 2d6+12 bludgeoning plus 1d6 force and 1d6 good. - **[Movanic Deva](/Monsters.aspx?ID=542)** Speed 30 feet, fly 40 feet; resistance 10 to negative; **Melee** bastard sword ([two-hand d12](/Traits.aspx?ID=198)), **Damage** 1d8+12 slashing plus 1d6 fire and 1d6 good. --- **Heightened (9th)** Your battle form is Large. You must have space to expand, or the spell is lost. You instead gain 60 temporary Hit Points, weakness 15 to evil damage, attack modifier +30, damage bonus +20, and Athletics +33.
_source.name: Angel Form

<title level="1" right="Spell 7" pfs="Standard">
[Contingency](/Spells.aspx?ID=1472)
<actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 321</row>

**Tradition**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** 10 minutes

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until your next daily preparations
</row>

</column>

---

You prepare a spell that will trigger later. While casting contingency, you also cast another spell of 4th rank or lower with a casting time of no more than 3 actions. This companion spell must be one that can affect you. You must make any decisions for the spell when you cast contingency, such as choosing a damage type for [_resist energy_](/Spells.aspx?ID=256). During the casting, choose a trigger under which the spell will be cast, using the same restrictions as for the trigger of a [Ready](/Equipment.aspx?ID=741) action. Once _contingency_ is cast, you can cause the companion spell to come into effect as a reaction with that trigger. It affects only you, even if it would affect more creatures. If you define complicated conditions, as determined by the GM, the trigger might fail. If you cast _contingency_ again, the newer casting supersedes the older.

---
**Heightened (8th)** You can choose a spell of 5th rank or lower.

**Heightened (9th)** You can choose a spell of 6th rank or lower.

**Heightened (10th)** You can choose a spell of 7th rank or lower.
_source.name: Contingency

<title level="1" right="Spell 7" pfs="Limited">
[Control Sand](/Spells.aspx?ID=652)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Extinction Curse</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Earth" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=55" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #155: Lord of the Black Sands](/Sources.aspx?ID=33) pg. 73</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Area** 5-foot emanation

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You whip up a small sandstorm around your body. When a creature starts its turn in the area or moves into the area, it must succeed at a Fortitude save or become [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7) for as long as it remains in the area; it is then temporarily immune to this dazzling effect for 10 minutes.

 Choose one of the following additional effects when you cast this spell. On subsequent rounds, you can switch to a different effect once per round as a free action triggered by sustaining the spell.

- **Sand Shield** You create a magical shield made of sand. The sand shield provides no benefit to AC, but it does allow you to use the [Shield Block](/Feats.aspx?ID=839) reaction and acts as a shield for this purpose. The sand shield has Hardness 14, 21 Hit Points, and no Broken Threshold; when the shield's HP are reduced to 0, you can't use its Shield Block reaction again until the next time you Sustain the Spell and choose the sand shield effect.
- **Sandblast** You direct a jet of sand at a single target. One creature of your choice within 30 feet takes 8d6 slashing damage (basic Reflex save). On a critical failure, the creature is also [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7) for 1 minute.
- **Sandstorm** The area of the spell expands to a 30-foot emanation, and any creature that starts its turn in the area or moves into the area takes 6d4 slashing damage (basic Reflex save) and must hold its breath or begin [suffocating](/Rules.aspx?ID=468).

---
**Heightened (+1)** Increase the sand shield's Hardness by 2 and its Hit Points by 1, the sandblast damage by 1d6, and the sandstorm damage by 1d4.
_source.name: Control Sand

<title level="1" right="Spell 7" pfs="Standard">
[Corrosive Body](/Spells.aspx?ID=888)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Acid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=3" />
<trait label="Polymorph" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=127" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 97 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You exhale corrosive gas, and acidic secretions coat your skin as you transform into a being of living acid. You gain [acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3) immunity. Any creature that touches you or damages you with an unarmed melee attack or non-reach melee weapon takes 3d6 acid damage, and your [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199) attacks deal 1d4 additional acid damage. The first time each round that you deal acid damage to a creature in this way, you gain 3d6 temporary HP as your body digests the eroded material and transforms it into a protective acid. When the spell ends, any remaining temporary HP expires as well. Your acid spells deal one additional die of acid damage (of the same damage die the spell uses). You can cast [_acid splash_](/Spells.aspx?ID=3) as an innate spell; the splash damage affects all creatures within 15 feet instead of the normal 5 feet.

---
**Heightened (9th)** Creatures touching you take 4d6 acid damage instead of 3d6, your unarmed attacks deal 2d4 additional acid damage, and you gain 5d6 temporary HP.
_source.name: Corrosive Body

**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 98 1.1 **Traditions** [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Duration** 1 minute --- You recreate your form entirely out of cosmic energy, transforming into a Large battle form. You must have enough space to expand into, or the spell is lost. When you cast this spell, choose to take on the powers of the moon or the sun. You have hands in this battle form and can use [manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104) actions. You can Dismiss the spell. You gain the following statistics and abilities regardless of the form that you choose:
  • AC = 21 + your level. Ignore your armor check's penalty and Speed reduction.
  • 20 temporary Hit Points.
  • [Darkvision](/Rules.aspx?ID=415).
  • One or more attacks specific to the battle form you use. You're trained with them. Your attack modifier is +25, and you use the listed damage. The melee attacks are Strength based (for the purpose of the [enfeebled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13) condition, for example), and the ranged attacks are Dexterity based. If your unarmed attack modifier is higher, you can use it instead.
  • [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) modifier of +25, unless your own is higher.
You also gain specific abilities based on the stellar body: - **Moon** Speed 30 feet, fly 50 feet; **Melee** fist ([agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d4+10 bludgeoning plus 1d6 fire; **Ranged** moonbeam (range 90 feet), **Damage** 2d4+10 fire; this form's fire damage is [silver](/Equipment.aspx?ID=379) for resistances, weaknesses, and the like; on a critical hit with either Strike, the target is [stupefied 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37) for 1 round. - **Sun** Speed 30 feet, fly 50 feet; **Melee** fist ([agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d6+10 fire plus 1d6 [persistent fire](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29); **Ranged** sunbeam ([range 90 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 1d6+10 fire plus 1d6 persistent fire; on a critical hit with either Strike, the target is [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7) for 1 round.
_source.name: Cosmic Form

When the target rolls a critical success on any skill check, it gets a success instead. When the target rolls a failure on any skill check, it gets a critical failure instead.

**Critical Failure** As success, but the duration is unlimited.

<title level="1" right="Spell 7" pfs="Standard">
[Dancing Fountain](/Spells.aspx?ID=1385)
<actions string="Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Water" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=165" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 172</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Area** 30-foot burst centered on you

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

Tapping the ground, you create a shallow pool of water that spreads over the affected area, and majestic sprays, jets, and mists of water erupt forth in a dazzling water show. When you Cast the Spell, and the first time each round you Sustain the spell, you can command the fountain to use one of the following displays, which is accompanied by a loud burst of music. The _dancing fountain_ is somewhat fickle in its desire for novelty, meaning it can't be commanded to use the same display on two consecutive turns.

- **Chasing Jets** A series of vertical jets shoot up in a chase sequence, forcing one creature within the fountain to [move](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) 15 feet in a direction of your choice unless it succeeds at a Reflex save against your spell DC. The fountain can't make a creature move outside its area.
- **Flashing Spray** Diffuse fog fills the area of the emanation. All creatures within the fountain become [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4), and all creatures outside the fountain become concealed to creatures within it. The spray persists until the beginning of your next turn.
- **Power Rings** The fountain blasts a series of rings of water into the air that land with a crash in a 10-foot burst centered on a location of your choice within the fountain. The falling torrent deals 10d6 bludgeoning damage to all creatures within the burst ([basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex).
_source.name: Dancing Fountain

<title level="1" right="Focus 7" pfs="Standard">
[Darklight](/Spells.aspx?ID=1060)
<actions string="Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Darkness" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=39" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Shadow" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=143" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 227 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

**Area** 20-foot burst

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

Shadows pour forth from your eyes, creating a field of [darkness](/Rules.aspx?ID=409) that prevents light from emanating within the area. Light doesn't enter the area; any non-magical light sources, such as a [torches](/Equipment.aspx?ID=60) or [lanterns](/Equipment.aspx?ID=29), don't emanate any light while inside the area, even if their light radius would extend beyond the darkness. The spell similarly suppresses magical [light](/Traits.aspx?ID=100) of the spell's level or lower.

 Light can't pass through, so creatures in the area can't see outside. Even creatures with [darkvision](/Rules.aspx?ID=415) (but not greater darkvision) can barely see through the darkness; any creatures seen through the darkness are [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4) to them. Creatures with greater darkvision can see through the darkness normally.

 Creatures who move into the field or start their turn within the field have some of the life and light sucked out of them, taking 2d6 bludgeoning damage and 2d6 negative damage, with a [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save. 

When you cast this spell, choose up to four allies in the area to spare from _darklight's_ effects. Until the spell ends, they're immune to damage from _darklight_ spells and can see through _darklight_ (but not other darkness) as though they had greater darkvision.

---
**Heightened (10th)** The bludgeoning and negative damage both increase to 3d6.
_source.name: Darklight

A manifested version of your deity's favored weapon appears in the air above and attacks the target, using your spell attack roll. On a hit, the weapon deals 7d12 force damage, or double damage on a critical hit.

 After the attack, whether it succeeds or fails, divine energy bursts from the weapon in a shock wave. It emits in a 10-foot-wide, 30-foot-long line starting from the target and continuing in a direction you choose. Choose an alignment your deity has (chaotic, evil, good, or lawful). Your target and any other creatures within the area of the spell take 5d6 damage of the chosen alignment type, with a [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. The spell gains the trait of the alignment you choose. If your deity is true neutral, the weapon doesn't create a shock wave.

---
**Heightened (9th)** The force damage increases by 1d12 and the alignment damage increases by 1d6.

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 325 **Tradition** [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2) **Range** 40 feet **Area** 40-foot emanation **Defense** Fortitude **Duration** varies --- You utter a potent litany from your faith, a mandate that harms those who oppose your ideals. You deal 7d10 spirit damage to your enemies in the area; each enemy must attempt a Fortitude save. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature takes half damage.
**Failure** The creature takes full damage and is enfeebled 2 for 1 minute.
**Critical Failure** The creature takes double damage and is enfeebled 2 for 1 minute. If you're on your home plane and the creature is not, the creature is sent back to its home plane. A creature of 10th level or lower must also succeed at a Will save or be [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28) for 1 minute; if it critically fails, it dies (this is a [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effect). --- **Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1d10, and the level of creatures that must attempt a second save on a critical failure increases by 2.
_source.name: Divine Decree

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 331 4.0 **Tradition** [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Duration** 1 minute --- You accept otherworldly energies into your body; while you are still recognizably yourself, you gain the features of one of your deity's servitors. Choose an alignment your deity has (chaotic, evil, good, or lawful). You can't cast this spell if you don't have a deity or your deity is true neutral. This spell gains the trait of the alignment you chose. If you were Medium or smaller, you become Large, as the effects of [_enlarge_](/Spells.aspx?ID=102). You must have space to expand into, or the spell is lost. You also gain the following benefits.
  • 40 temporary Hit Points.
  • A fly Speed equal to your Speed.
  • Weakness 10 to the alignment opposite the one you chose.
  • A +1 status bonus to saves against spells.
  • [Darkvision](/Rules.aspx?ID=415).
  • Your unarmed attacks and weapons deal 1 additional damage of the chosen alignment type.
  • One or more unarmed melee attacks. If you chose good or lawful, your fist attacks deal 2d8 damage. If you chose chaotic, you gain a bite unarmed attack that deals 2d10 piercing damage. If you chose evil, you gain a claws unarmed attack that deals 2d8 slashing damage and has the [agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170) and [finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179) traits.
--- **Heightened (9th)** The temporary Hit Points increase to 60, the weakness increases to 15, and the duration increases to 10 minutes.
_source.name: Divine Vessel

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 327 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 enemy of level 15 or lower **Defense** Fortitude **Duration** sustained up to 1 minute --- You create a temporary duplicate of an enemy to fight on your behalf. The target can attempt a Fortitude save to disrupt the spell. The duplicate appears in an unoccupied space adjacent to the target and has the target's attack modifier, AC, saving throw modifiers, Perception, and skill modifiers, but it has only 70 Hit Points and lacks the target's special abilities, including immunities, resistances, and weaknesses. It has no magic items except [_weapon potency_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=281) runes. The duplicate gains the [minion](/Traits.aspx?ID=109) trait, and it can only Stride and Strike. Its Strikes deal the target's normal damage but don't apply added effects, since it doesn't have special abilities. The spell automatically ends if the duplicate's Hit Points drop to 0. The duplicate attacks your enemies to the best of its abilities. You can also try to give it additional instructions; when you Sustain the spell, you can also Command a Minion as part of your action, but the GM determines whether the duplicate follows your command. The duplicate is unstable, so each turn after it takes its actions, it loses 4d6 Hit Points. It's not a living creature, and it can never regain its lost Hit Points in any way. **Critical Success** You fail to create a duplicate.
**Success** The duplicate deals half damage with its Strikes and the duration is reduced to a maximum of 2 rounds.
**Failure** The duplicate works as described. --- **Heightened (+1)** The level of creature you can target increases by 2. The duplicate has 10 more HP.
_source.name: Duplicate Foe

May contain spoilers from Extinction Curse **Source** [Pathfinder #154: Siege of the Dinosaurs](/Sources.aspx?ID=31) pg. 74 **Tradition** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Area** 30-foot emanation centered on you **Duration** sustained up to 1 minute --- Your eyes glow with an entrancing radiance that captivates those who meet your gaze. Any creature that ends its turn within the emanation must attempt a Will save.
**Critical Success** The target is unaffected and becomes immune to this particular casting of the spell.
**Success** The target is unaffected.
**Failure** Until the end of its next turn, the target is [stupefied 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37) and [fascinated](/Conditions.aspx?ID=14).
**Critical Failure** Until the end of its next turn, the target is stupefied 4, fascinated, and can't take reactions. In addition, all creatures and objects other than you are [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4) from the target. During any round you Sustain the Spell, you can use a single action, which has the [manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104) trait, to focus your entrancing eyes on a single creature you can see within 30 feet. This creature must immediately make a Will save against the spell as if it were ending its turn in the emanation. If the creature was already fascinated by your entrancing eyes before its save, a failed save causes it to be [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28) for 1 round. You can’t use this action to focus on the same creature more than once per round.
_source.name: Entrancing Eyes

<title level="1" right="Spell 7" pfs="Standard">
[Ethereal Jaunt](/Spells.aspx?ID=105)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Teleportation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=156" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 336 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You travel to the Ethereal Plane, which overlaps the Material Plane. Material Plane creatures can't see you, and you can move through things on the Material Plane. You move at half your normal Speeds, but can move in any direction (including up and down).

 You can see onto the Material Plane within a radius of 60 feet; it is gray, hazy, and concealed from you. You can't affect the Material Plane, and you can't be affected by the Material Plane except by force effects and abjurations originating there.

 When the spell ends, you return to the Material Plane. If you're in the air, you fall (unless you can fly), and if you're inside an object, you're pushed into the nearest open space and take 1d6 damage per 5 feet you were pushed.

 If you cast this spell when not on the Material Plane, it is lost.

---
**Heightened (9th)** You can target up to five additional willing creatures at a range of 30 feet. The duration is up to 10 minutes.
_source.name: Ethereal Jaunt

 Your unarmed attacks deal an additional 1d4 fire damage, and your fire spells deal one additional die of fire damage (of the same damage die the spell uses). <title level="1" right="Spell 7" pfs="Standard">
[Force Cage](/Spells.aspx?ID=690)
<actions string="Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Force" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=75" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 219 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Area** 1 cube 20 feet on each side

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Saving Throw** 
Reflex

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You create an immobile, invisible prison of sheer force. The cage is a 20-foot cube made of bands of force, each a half inch thick and a half inch apart, that extend to the [Ethereal Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=9). Each creature in the area where you create the cage must attempt a Reflex save. If such a creature fails, it becomes trapped inside the cage. If it succeeds, it's pushed outside the cage into a space of its choice. If a creature in the area is too big to fit inside the prison, the spell automatically fails.

 The cage has AC 10, Hardness 20, and 40 Hit Points, and it's immune to critical hits and precision damage. A creature capable of passing through the space between the bars (typically a Tiny creature) can leave; all others are confined within. Attacks with a weapon too large to fit between the bars can't pass through the cage, and the bars provide standard cover even against attacks that can pass through the gaps. Spells and breath weapons can pass through the cage uninhibited.

 _Force cage_ is immune to [counteracting](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) effects of its level or lower, but it is automatically destroyed by a [_disintegrate_](/Spells.aspx?ID=76) spell of any level, or by contact with a _[rod of cancellation](/Equipment.aspx?ID=742)_ or [_sphere of annihilation_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=620).
_source.name: Force Cage

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Area** line up to 120 feet

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Saving Throw** 
[basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex

</row>

</column>

---

You place a palm to your lips and exhale a cold breath, whipping up a gust of wind that freezes the air's ambient moisture into a flurry of jagged shards. The flurry deals 9d6 cold damage and 9d6 slashing damage to all foes, with a basic Reflex save, but the gust flows harmlessly around your allies. The wind then picks you up and carries you to the other end of the area; though your movement within the gust can still trigger reactions, the storm of ice crystals prevents you from being affected by any effects, except for those that would [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) the spell's magic or that the GM decides would affect snow.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The cold and slashing damage each increase by 1d6.
_source.name: Frigid Flurry

<title level="1" right="Spell 7" pfs="Standard">
[Heaving Earth](/Spells.aspx?ID=1335)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Earth" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=55" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 95</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

**Target** 1 creature or object on the ground
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Defense**
Reflex

</row>

</column>

---

You strike the ground, and unleash a wave that travels through the struck surface to the target. The effect ends as soon as it can't travel through a solid surface, such as a stone floor. Each creature in a line between you and the target is shaken by tremors and must attempt a Reflex saving throw against your spell DC. A creature that fails this save is [pushed](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) 10 feet away from you.

 The wave explodes once it reaches the target, showering the target with earth and stone and dealing 12d10 bludgeoning damage with a basic Reflex save. A target that fails its save against this explosion is also pushed back 10 feet and knocked [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31). A creature subject to the explosion doesn't need to save against the tremors.

---
**Heightened (9th)** The wave explodes on one additional target of your choice in the line to the final target.
_source.name: Heaving Earth

<title level="1" right="Spell 7" pfs="Standard">
[Hungry Depths](/Spells.aspx?ID=1391)
<actions string="Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Void" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=510" />
<trait label="Water" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=165" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Rage of Elements](/Sources.aspx?ID=205) pg. 173</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

**Area** 5-foot burst (see text)

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Defense**
[basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

A spiral of dark, corrupted water appears in the ground, plunging open a door to the depths that seems to descend for miles. Disembodied glowing eyes and gnashing teeth spin within the vortex, consuming anything that crosses their path. 

All creatures in the area take 4d8 piercing damage plus 4d4 void damage (basic Reflex save). Each time you Sustain the spell, you can increase the vortex's radius by 5 feet, to a maximum of 15 feet, or you can move the vortex up to 10 feet in a straight line. Each creature the vortex moves through takes the damage with a basic Reflex save.A creature can take damage from _hungry depths_ only once per round. 

 If cast underwater, _hungry depths_ instead fills a 40-foot-tall cylinder with a 5-foot radius.

---
**Heightened (9th)** The vortex deals 5d8 piercing damage and 5d4 void damage.
_source.name: Hungry Depths

_source.markdown:
**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 111 1.1 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 30 feet **Target** up to 5 creatures **Saving Throw** Will --- You inflict your targets with a crushing doubt about everyone and everything around them. For the duration, each target is unwilling to receive any effects that require a willing target (in case the effect was secretly an attack), refuse to ingest anything (in case the substances have been replaced with poisons and cursed duplicates), doesn't treat anyone as an ally (in case its friends were replaced by an impostor), and doesn't believe anything it's told (in case of lies, though this doesn't mean the creature automatically believes the opposite either). It doesn't even fully trust its own ability to [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26), as it becomes convinced it most likely remembered false information, as from a critical failure on a check to Recall Knowledge. Finally, the creature takes 6d6 mental damage at the end of each of its turns (with no save) unless it spent at least 1 action that turn [Seeking](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) or otherwise interacting with its surroundings in an attempt to disbelieve the illusions that it feels are obviously surrounding it. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature is affected for 1 round.
**Failure** The creature is affected for 1 minute.
**Critical Failure** The creature is affected for 1 hour.
_source.name: Inexhaustible Cynicism
